content.title: Coronary Fibromuscular Dysplasia
content.description: FMD affecting coronary arteries and its clinical manifestations

key_concepts.details: Increasingly recognized as cause of spontaneous coronary artery dissection (SCAD)
Up to 50-75% of SCAD patients have extracoronary FMD on screening
Consider screening for extracoronary FMD in SCAD patients (renal, carotid, iliac)
Conservative management preferred for SCAD; avoid stenting if possible

content.clinical_significance: Coronary FMD/SCAD association has implications for systemic FMD screening
content.statement: Coronary Fibromuscular Dysplasia is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Genetic-Disorders that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Coronary Fibromuscular Dysplasia helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Coronary Fibromuscular Dysplasia include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Coronary Fibromuscular Dysplasia.
